```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(warning = FALSE)

library(tidyverse)
library(ipumsr)
library(srvyr)
library(haven)

```


```{r loading data}

setwd("/Users/marlyn/Downloads/Intro_to_Data_Science/Final_Project")
ddi <- read_ipums_ddi("cps_00002.xml")
data <- read_ipums_micro(ddi) %>%
  janitor::clean_names()
cps_svy <- as_survey_design(data, weights = asecwt)
#do we need to apply weights as well for our final project? 
glimpse(data)

asec2019 <- cps_svy %>%
  filter(year == 2019 & month == 3)


```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
